meanings.definition: To bias or influence incorrectly or unfairly.
meanings.sent1: She was misbiasing the experiment by only focusing on one variable.
meanings.sent2: The news article was misbiasing the readers by presenting only one side of the story.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous elf was misbiasing the outcome of the game by secretly moving the pieces.
meanings.sent4: His strong opinions were misbiasing his judgment, making it hard for him to see the truth.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's favoritism was misbiasing the students' grades, causing unfair results.

meanings.definition: The act of unfairly influencing or distorting.
meanings.sent1: The misbiasing of the data led to inaccurate conclusions.
meanings.sent2: Detecting misbiasing in the study helped improve its reliability.
meanings.sent3: The misbiasing in the painting made the landscape look surreal.
meanings.sent4: The misbiasing of the facts created a cloud of doubt over the investigation.
meanings.sent5: The misbiasing of the statistics made it challenging to trust the results.
